comment: This class would be so much easier if it wasn't for the professor. Attendance is mandatory, but the lectures/discussions were boring and uninteresting. Project guidelines seemed incomplete and unclear at times. 2 Exams, BOTH OPEN NOTE. She has a thick accent and has a quiet voice. Didn't learn anything in this class. Stay away at all costs.

Every class has an ICA but you can miss 4 lectures. Very soft spoken so if you can't hear well, SIT IN THE FRONT. Projects are pretty easy. Lectures are pretty boring. Hardest project was an excel assignment. Final project was a group project and can be done in under 2 hours and she gave us a whole month. Quizzes and tests are online, no lockdown.

Professor Gao was okay. Attendance mandatory but you can miss 4. Overall a pretty easy class, just annoying projects (but they're required by every IS2200 class). One group project and open note midterm and final

This class would be a VERY easy A if not for the professor. The tests and quizzes are incredibly easy, but besides that, the class is kinda trash. Attendance is mandatory despite the lectures almost always being irrelevant. Even with that, the class wouldn't be that bad if the projects weren't awful. THe instructions for the projects are very vague

DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!! She has a thick accent and speaks quietly, making her lectures incomprehensible, boring, and useless. The room layout is awful with desktops staring at you, not letting you see the board or the professor. She also checks attendance everyday with ICA's. All the good feedback was probably written by her using AI. AWFUL CLASS!!

The class was easy, would not take her again. Lectures over the material, yes, but not the most helpful material. With projects and grades, she never typically explains how to complete the work right. She doesn't like admitting when she makes a mistake in homework or a test/project, and will only respond to emails of feedback with an AI response.

This professor does not know how to run the class. All of her assignments are haphazardly thrown together, and she rarely goes over the instructions or provides a clear understanding. She has a thick accent and is very soft spoken, and most of the time she hardly talks about the material. I've had to teach myself this entire class. Don't take her.

Awful unfocused curriculum and class structure made worse by a bad prof. She is quiet, the room layout is awful, attendance is mandatory even though lectures are useless, and she does not communicate clearly about instructions or when asking for help. Class should be an easy A, but her poor teaching makes this class much harder than it needs to be.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: I would not recommend taking this professor. I have emailed her multiple times during the semester asking to met with me and somehow she is never able to because she's always “busy” and sends AI type emails so they are hard to understand. She gave my class completely wrong/ little information about a big excel project and fixed it after submitting.

Her lectures are completely incomprehensible, and often have nothing to do with the class content. Despite that, attendance policy is strict. There are projects with very vague instructions and she gives very little help on them. There is a final project and you can't pick your groups. The only saving grace is all exams and quizzes are open note.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: The lecture room I was in was a computer lab room, therefore there was a blank monitor in front of our faces leading to a class where only the professor's forehead is shown and the board not being seeable at all, but that is encouraged in this class as no one pays attention. She is also very quiet.

The teacher has very unusual attendance policies, she makes you submit a unique task every class day as an ICA. Assignments for this class were obviously lazily made. Not sure if it's her fault or the school's, but you will leave this class feeling you've learned nothing. Also grading and assignments can be ambiguous. Curriculum is poorly made.
I am pretty sure the bad ratings are because people didn't really do their work but I promise there's no way you can fail this class. 100% recommend her

There are in-class activities but they are so easy! She cancels the class for us to catch up on work, no lockdown or webcam so use your resources. It is so hard to not get an A in this class. She's so sweet and is willing to always help. The only big grade is the group project but she is lenient. TAKE HERR!!!!!!

I don't understand how she isn't 5/5. The quizzes and exams is without lock down and web cam and u can use your "resources" At the end she has a big group project but she grades easy! TAKE HERRRR she's chill
Xiaoling was a great professor! No complaints at all. I would definitely take again.

Not a hard class, but if your taking her class recommend take every some days because she has In-class activity and it counts for a grade. But if you have friends then you can do the in-class activity at home. Overall don't laid back just do work that all it's not hard just simple. Quizizz, Midterm, and Final is ONLINE, NO WEBCAM, NO LOCKDOW.
Super good professor! Always willing to help and her class isn't too hard at all. Only a couple of projects that every IS class takes and a few quizzes that are all due at the end of the semester!

She talks a lot in lectures, but the class activity is for a grade. The class activities aren't hard at all though, simple stuff that doesn't really require the lecture. The quizzes were easy, and both midterm and final are online with open note and stuff. The group project is also easy, you present it but not in front of the entire class.
attendance is important for in class activities. the work is not hard per se there is just a lot of it. quizzes are open note no lockdown browser or camera and there are a few larger projects

Very boring long lectures that don't adequately cover material. Group In Class assignments that require short casual presentations every class. 2 excel assignments and 2 written communication projects. Lots of online quizzes, 1 midterm, 1 final. Large group research project at the end with formal presentation and paper. Fair grader.

This class is not hard but there is a lot of work and reading. The lectures barely reinforce the text materials but attendance is important because of in class assignments. Gao is a very nice lady but her lectures are boring and she seems to be winging it most of the time. The group projects were fine. Don't procrastinate or you'll get behind.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Lectures were useless and barely related to the content of the class. Really easy in the beginning and then towards the end, numerous projects were assigned which were slightly difficult but videos were provided that made it easier to complete. Only the quizzes are graded out of the learning modules. In class activities were also graded.

Prof. Gao's class was easy, just a lot of work. She canceled classes a lot; we only met up two times a week on a good week. Her lectures are youtube heavy, and she makes you do mandatory in-class activities. The group project was also miserable - I left with an A. If you stay on top of the work, you'll do fine.

Easy A=Professor Gao,2 tests all online + open for a week 50 points, bunch of connect quizzes, text book on connect though I never used it, cancels class a lot + extensions, about 15 in class activities that make up 125 points but simple + work w the ppl around you, one group project at the end with a presentation, doesnt actually teach but easy A

I havent gotten my final grade yet but dont listen to the bad reviews. THIS CLASS IS EASY WITH HER. Class is organized and you have so much time to finish assignments. She has a thick accent but shes easy to understand IMO. She is super sweet and actually cares about the progress/well being of students.
Please do take her if you want to pass the course with a good grade and learn something in the course. She is very kind in understanding and helping any student that reaches out to her.
She is pretty knowledgeable about SAP processes. Weekly hands on practices on SAP system are must.

Easily one of the most difficult classes I've taken so far in college. Not because of the course content, but because you won't actually learn anything in class. Anything you need to learn will be done on your own time. Everything feels disorganized and due dates get moved around a lot. Good luck.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: She's an ok teacher But the class is so easy that she doesn't need to be great. All the quizzes are super easy and same with the midterm and final. A lot of projects though. That isn't her fault its the curriculum . The good thing about her is that she's super understanding and will let you turn things in late. Just stay on task and you'll be fine

I feel bad for her bc I think she was forced to teach the class last minute, but the course was very unorganized. She did not know what the assignments she gave us were. When asked questions in class, she was unable to answer any properly. If the class was a little more organized it could work, but please choose someone else for your own sake.

Worst professor at KSU. Doesnt know what shes talking about, all assignments are taken and signed by another professor, had to reach out to department chair multiple times. She gave me a 90 on my biography discussion which was just my name, major, and hobbies.

This class is not very hard. There's a lot of excel but it's structured so you learn as you along and you'll need the skills for later classes/life. The lectures are pretty boring but the assignments and content are interesting.

She is such a nice lady and would always give us extensions on assignments. There is a lot of work but most of it is due before the midterm and then the rest before the final so if you pace yourself its not too bad. The lectures can be very boring, assignments can be hard but she offers help sometimes. Attendance not mandatory at all.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Awful professor. Extremely unorganized and unclear about due dates. Reads directly from powerpoints every class. extremely hard to get in contact with her unless you are in class. DO NOT TAKE.

Caring Professor. Took time to help me understand some key concepts. 
Not a difficult class. Got exposure to many new concepts.

She seems sweet, but sometimes is hard to understand, as she goes off of PowerPoints and is not organized whatsoever. She was really difficult to get a hold of unless you're in class, and probably is not the best professor to go with for this class.

she wasnt the best teacher, she didnt really know what she was teaching fr. she just gave us work based on what the other teachers did. easy class just know you wont learn. she isnt very organized either, dont count on getting an email back.
